name: unappropriated
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
law not kept for a particular person or organization, or for a particular purpose: The Salt Basin is an unappropriated new water source. Legislators left £3.74 million of revenue in the current year budget unappropriated.
finance & economics Unappropriated profit is profit (= money earned) that is kept in a business and not given to owners or shareholders (= people who own part of a company and therefore get part of the company's profits): Reserves created by the bank, and retained earnings, i.e. unappropriated profit, also form part of the bank’s resources. Whether to issue dividends, and what amount, is calculated mainly on the basis of the company's unappropriated profit and its earning prospects for the coming year.
More examplesFewer examplesThe lake has a lot of unappropriated water - water that can be sold.The commissioner of general services has to maintain an inventory and audit of every unappropriated state property that has been sold, transferred, conveyed, or exchanged.The study will evaluate existing water supply in the area, including groundwater and unappropriated Snake River water.
